trans-unit.source: Add Push Notifications to Android App with Azure Mobile Apps
trans-unit.target: Add Push Notifications to Android App with Azure Mobile Apps

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Apps to send push notifications to your Android app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Apps to send push notifications to your Android app.

trans-unit.source: Add Push Notifications to your Android App
trans-unit.target: Add Push Notifications to your Android App

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add push notifications to the [Android quick start] project so that every time a record is inserted, a push notification is sent.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add push notifications to the [Android quick start] project so that every time a record is inserted, a push notification is sent.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the [Android quick start] tutorial, which you must complete first.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the [Android quick start] tutorial, which you must complete first.

trans-unit.source: If you do not use the downloaded quick start server project, you must add the push notification extension package to your project.
trans-unit.target: If you do not use the downloaded quick start server project, you must add the push notification extension package to your project.

trans-unit.source: For more information about server extension packages, see [Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about server extension packages, see [Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:

trans-unit.source: [Google account](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=268302) with a verified email address.
trans-unit.target: [Google account](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=268302) with a verified email address.

trans-unit.source: [Visual Studio Community 2013](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/p/?LinkID=391934)—not needed for a Node.js backend project.
trans-unit.target: [Visual Studio Community 2013](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/p/?LinkID=391934)—not needed for a Node.js backend project.

trans-unit.source: Complete the [quickstart tutorial](../app-service-mobile-android-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: Complete the [quickstart tutorial](../app-service-mobile-android-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: Create a Notification Hub
trans-unit.target: Create a Notification Hub

trans-unit.source: Enable Google Cloud Messaging
trans-unit.target: Enable Google Cloud Messaging

trans-unit.source: Configure the Mobile App backend to send push requests
trans-unit.target: Configure the Mobile App backend to send push requests

trans-unit.source: Update the server project to send push notifications
trans-unit.target: Update the server project to send push notifications

trans-unit.source: Publish the mobile backend to Azure
trans-unit.target: Publish the mobile backend to Azure

trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your app
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your app

trans-unit.source: Verify Android SDK Version
trans-unit.target: Verify Android SDK Version

trans-unit.source: Your next step is to install Google Play services.
trans-unit.target: Your next step is to install Google Play services.

trans-unit.source: Google Cloud Messaging has some minimum API level requirements for development and testing, which the **minSdkVersion** property in the Manifest must conform to.
trans-unit.target: Google Cloud Messaging has some minimum API level requirements for development and testing, which the **minSdkVersion** property in the Manifest must conform to.

trans-unit.source: If you will be testing with an older device, then consult [Set Up Google Play Services SDK] to determine how low you can set this value, and set it appropriately.
trans-unit.target: If you will be testing with an older device, then consult [Set Up Google Play Services SDK] to determine how low you can set this value, and set it appropriately.

trans-unit.source: Add Google Play Services to the project
trans-unit.target: Add Google Play Services to the project

trans-unit.source: Add code
trans-unit.target: Add code

trans-unit.source: Test the app against the published mobile service
trans-unit.target: Test the app against the published mobile service

trans-unit.source: You can test the app by directly attaching an Android phone with a USB cable, or by using a virtual device in the emulator.
trans-unit.target: You can test the app by directly attaching an Android phone with a USB cable, or by using a virtual device in the emulator.

trans-unit.source: More
trans-unit.target: More

trans-unit.source: Tags allow you to target segmented customers with pushes.
trans-unit.target: Tags allow you to target segmented customers with pushes.

trans-unit.source: [Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md) shows you how to add tags to a device installation.
trans-unit.target: [Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md) shows you how to add tags to a device installation.
